page.title: 03MELLASTON FARM HUNDLETON
page.content: This farm covers 8 acres of woodland, 90 grass and 30 barley. Friesian and Hereford cattle are reared. Mr. Adrian Thomas is the manager and Giles Davids does the general work rearing calves, fertilising and sowing. A contractor comes in with a combine harvester. The straw is used for bedding. The owner is Mr. John James. International tractors are used, 2 of them,together with a fertiliser, dung-spreader, mower, roller, chain harrows, a plough and 4 trailers. There are 2 covered yards, 1 cowshed and 10 stables. Beef cattle are brought to market in Pembroke and Carmarthen in August. There are 9 horses, 51 calves and 58 fat cattle. There are 2 sheepdogs, Nellie and Patch.The horses are used for fox-hunting and for rounding-up the 500 head of cattle on the 8000 acres owned on the Castlemartin range.
